page.title: 10Young N.Luffenham mother
page.content: This young mother is a native of N.L. and attended the old village school. She recollects the building of the present school.After leaving full-time education she worked in Stamford Library. She left to start a family. Her young family prevents her from going{out}to work but she is a registered childminder. Apart from a few "at home" sales parties and some sport facilities at R.A.F. N.L., there are no other activities for young housewives. Weekly bulk shopping is at a Stamford supermarket and everyday needs are from the village shop. Unable to drive she relies on the poor bus service and her children cannot participate in the organised activities most of which are outside the area. Without a car she depends on meeting local friends for coffee or lunch for her social needs.
